definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: During our school days on the road, I met like-minded students.
sentences.chinese: 在求学路上，我也遇到了志同道合的同学。

sentences.english: To have firend s come to you from afar, is that not after all delightful?
sentences.chinese: 有志同道合的人从远方来，不也很快乐么？

sentences.english: I with they of one mind, then joined a train fan troops.
sentences.chinese: 我与他们志同道合，便加入了火车迷队伍。

sentences.english: Tennessee said that he and I were kindred spirits and wanted us to work together.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西说，他和我志同道合，希望我们能一起合作。

sentences.english: No wonder they had something in common.
sentences.chinese: 也怪不得他们会有一点点”志同道合“。

sentences.english: Is it not a joy to have likeminded friends come from afar?
sentences.chinese: 有志同道合的人从远方来，不也快乐吗？

sentences.english: So, where do you go to find English speakers with like-minded interests?
sentences.chinese: 那么，到哪去找与你志同道合的说英语的人呢？

sentences.english: And a group of noble-minded people, " she adds."
sentences.chinese: “和一组崇高的志同道合的人士，”她说。

sentences.english: These places are almost certain to attract like-minded peers.
sentences.chinese: 这些地方都会吸引志同道合的年轻人。

sentences.english: He forms WCS with a group of like-minded friends.
sentences.chinese: 与一班志同道合的朋友组成WCS。

sentences.english: The company is led by a group of experienced professionals with proven track records in PV industry.
sentences.chinese: 友晁是由一群志同道合的太阳能专业人士组成。

sentences.english: As a result, you can make new friends that have the same interest.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话你就可以结交到志同道合的新朋友。

sentences.english: Being parents, such people do not burden their kids with petty-minded meddling.
sentences.chinese: 作为父母，这样的人不负担孩子轻微志同道合的干涉。

sentences.english: Cheerz Company requires a group of partners to achieve the together ideal.
sentences.chinese: 茄子公司需要一群志同道合的朋友去实现共同的理想。

sentences.english: I made many new friends with the same hobbies we help each other to improve.
sentences.chinese: 我交了很多志同道合的朋友，我们相互帮忙共同提高。

definition: to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to get to know sb/to meet sb for the first time
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
